shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Sinodos (fols. 2ra-105vb), incomplete I-1) Statutes or Commandments (tǝʾǝzazat) of the Apostles (fols. 2ra-2vb, 6ra-11vb, 18ra-18vb, 20ra-26vb, 54ra-54vb, 76ra-80vb, 82ra-82vb, 105ra-105vb), incomplete I-2) Canons of the Council of Nicaea (20) (fols. 3ra-3vb, 12ra-12vb, 14ra-14va [explicit]), incomplete I-3) Canons of the Council of Nicaea (84) (fols. 4ra-4vb, 13ra-rb, 14va [incipit]-17vb, 27ra-28rb [explicit], 29ra-34vb), incomplete I-4) Exposition and admonition to believers on wise conduct (fols. 5ra-5vb, 57va [incipit]-63vb, 99ra-100vb), incomplete I-5) Epistle 70 by Cyprian of Carthage (fols. 28rb [incipit]-28vb, 81ra-81va [explicit]) I-6) Canons of the Council of Laodicea (fols. 35ra-37vb, 41ra-42vb [explicit], 97ra [incipit]-98vb) I-7) Discourse of the 318 Nicene Fathers on the Right Faith and on the Monastic Life (fols. 38ra-38rb [explicit], 81vb [incipit], 89ra-90rb) I-8) Canons of the Council of Gangra (fols. 38va [incipit]-40rb [explicit]) I-9) Canons of the Council of Sardica (fols. 40rb [incipit]-40vb, 91ra-92vb [explicit]) I-10) Interpretation of the Ten Commandments by John Chrysostom (fols. 42va [incipit]-49va [explicit]) I-11) Exposition and admonition on the role of Our Lord in our salvation (also called On the Essence of the Holy Trinity) (fols. 49va [incipit]-51rb [explicit]) I-12) Exposition and admonition on the way of virtue and perdition (also called How to Distinguish between God and Evil) (fols. 51rb [incipit]-52ra [explicit]) I-13) Exposition and admonition on the fear of God (fols. 52rb [incipit]-53vb, 65ra-65va [explicit], 83ra-83vb), incomplete I-14) Exposition and admonition of Gregory of Armenia against the Jews (fols. 56ra-57va [explicit], 73rb [incipit]-75vb) I-15) Exposition and admonition to Believers on Wise Conduct (fols. 57va [incipit]-63vb, 99ra-101vb [explicit]), incomplete I-16) Exposition and admonition on not associating with Jews (also called On the Former People of God) (fols. 65vb [incipit]-73rb [explicit]) I-17) Canons of Simon the Canaanite (n°1) (fols. 84ra-86rb [explicit]), incomplete I-18) Letter of Peter to Clement (fols. 86rb [incipit]-87ra [explicit]), incomplete I-19) Apostolic Canons: 81 canons (fols. 87ra [incipit]-88vb), incomplete I-20) Canons of the Council of Antioch (fols. 92vb [incipit]-97ra [explicit]) I-2) Penitential canons given to St. Peter (fols. 101vb [incipit]-104vb), incomplete
Additiones 1-3.

dcomments.dcomment: 15th cent. Fols. 1, 19 and 106 are leaves originating from the 15th-cent. manuscript AQG-005 (s. Additiones 1-3).

txstates.txstate: The boards and the original sewing are missing. Some of the leaves are sewn together with stitch repairs (e.g. fols. 56-63). All fols. are very worn. Many fols. are misplaced, many are missing. Many fols. are damaged by water (e.g. fols. 28-30, 84-88). Some fols. are torn with loss of text (e.g. fols. 3-4). Tear carefully amended on fol. 102.

bindings.binding: Both wooden boards and the threads of the binding are missing. Two pairs of sewing stations.

txfolios.txfolio: Fol. 38 photographed twice; fol. 55 originates from another manuscript and was not photographed

squires.squire: Due to the condition of the Ms., the structure of the quires cannot be established.

taunit.mr-info: All data for fol. 12r. The size of the text area is not constant throughout the Ms.
taunit.ln-info: The number of lines is not constant throughout the Ms.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; incipit of Text I and its sections; numbers, titles and incipits of the canons; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Fol. 38 photographed twice because a part of the text was hidden by a stub. - Fol. numbered 55 was not photographed.

additional.cont: Fol. 1r-v: Gädlä sämaˁtat, Vitae of Saints and Martyrs, fragment (incipit page of the Vita of Hernewos).
additional.det: The leaf originates from the 15th-cent. manuscript AQG-005.

additional.cont: Fol. 19r-v: Gädlä sämaˁtat, Vitae of Saints and Martyrs, fragment.
additional.det: The leaf originates from the 15th-cent. manuscript AQG-005. It contains the colophon mentioning 6955 year of mercy (= 1463 A.D.) as the date of completion of the writing, and ʾabunä Ṗeṭros as the commissioner. The colophon is preceded by an extensive (historiographic?) note (fol. 19r) mentioning Metropolitan Gäbrәʾel (who arrived in Ethiopia in 1438 and died possibly in 1458, s. EAE II, 632).

additional.cont: Fol. 106r-v: Gädlä sämaˁtat, Vitae of Saints and Martyrs, fragment.
additional.det: The leaf originates from the 15th-cent. manuscript AQG-005.

extras.extra: - Unclear note (possibly a directive for the minister): fol. 35v.
